title: HP Land Revenue Act
details:
The procedural backbone.
Sec 16: Power of Review (90 days).
Sec 34: Reporting acquisition (3 months).
Sec 38: Entries in RoR cannot be varied without mutation.
Sec 45: Presumption of Truth.
Sec 107: Demarcation.
Sec 112: Penalty for destroying Survey Marks (Burji).
Sec 118: Road Encroachment.
Sec 163: Ejectment of encroachers.
River Action: Deals with 'Burdi' (Land washed away) and 'Baramad' (Land recovered).

title: HP Tenancy & Land Reforms Act
details:
Sec 104: Vesting of proprietary rights (Ownership) in tenants.
Sec 118: Bans transfer to non-agriculturists.
Exceptions: Gift to relatives, transfer by Will.
Khudkasht: Land under personal cultivation.
Resumption: Landowner can resume up to 3 acres (unirrigated) / 1.5 acres (irrigated) from a non-occupancy tenant for self-cultivation.

title: HP Village Common Lands Act
details:
Vesting: 'Shamlat' land vests in State Govt.
Utilization: 50% for grazing (Charand), 50% 'Allotable Pool'.
Purpose: Distribution to landless persons (less than 1 acre holding) and eligible persons (SC/ST/IRDP).
Exemptions: Lands used for religious purposes, cremation grounds, or water bodies.

title: HP Holdings Consolidation Act
details:
Chakbandi: Consolidation of fragmented holdings.
Procedure: Notification -> Advisory Committee -> Draft Scheme -> Confirmation.
Killabandi: Rectangularization of fields.
Pass Book: Issued to landowners containing consolidated holding details.

title: HP Ceiling on Land Holdings Act
details:
Limits family ownership.
Limit: ~10 Acres (Irrigated/2 crops) to ~30 Acres (Barren).
Standard Acre: Calculated based on productivity (1 Standard Acre = 1 Acre receiving perennial irrigation).
Surplus Area: Vests in State Govt free from all encumbrances.

title: HP Nautor Land Rules
details:
Grant of Govt waste land.
Limit: Up to 20 Bighas.
Eligibility: Landless residents of the estate.
Restrictions: No Nautor within 100 meters of a road or inside a forest without clearance.
Patta: The legal document conferring title.

title: HP Transfer of Land (Regulation) Act
details:
Protects Tribal land.
Scope: Scheduled Areas (Kinnaur, Lahaul, Pangi, Bharmour).
Restriction: No transfer from Tribal to Non-Tribal without DC's written permission.
Benami Transactions: Specifically targets transactions where a non-tribal buys land in the name of a tribal to bypass the law.

title: Hindu Succession Act
details:
Governs Inheritance (Warasat).
Class I Heirs: Son, Daughter, Widow, Mother (share equally).
2005 Amendment: Daughters recognized as Coparceners (birthright in ancestral property).
Conflict: In tribal areas, customary law (Wajib-ul-arz) often conflicts with this Act.

title: Indian Registration Act
details:
Section 17: Compulsory registration for immovable property value > â‚¹100.
Patwari's Role: Must update Jamabandi *only* after receiving the registered deed or mutation order. Cannot change ownership based on unregistered agreements (Iqrarnama).

title: HP Panchayati Raj Act
details:
Section 12: Panchayat power to remove encroachments from public paths.
Family Register: Parivar Register maintained by Panchayat Sahayak; vital for verifying 'Bonafide Himachali' status.
Patwari's Role: Provides 'Naksha' (Map) to identify encroachment boundaries.

title: HP Public Service Guarantee Act
details:
Timely service delivery.
Nakal (Jamabandi): Same Day/24 hrs.
Attestation of Affidavit: Same Day.
Income/Caste Certificate: Report by Patwari within 3 days.
Designated Officer: Tehsildar/Naib Tehsildar is responsible for ensuring delivery.

title: RFCTLARR Act (Land Acquisition)
details:
Right to Fair Compensation.
SIA: Social Impact Assessment is mandatory.
Compensation: Higher of Circle Rate or Market Value x Multiplier + 100% Solatium.
R&R: Rehabilitation & Resettlement benefits for displaced families.

title: HP Roadside Land Control Act
details:
Regulates construction near roads.
Controlled Width: No construction allowed within specified distance (e.g., 5m from edge) of Scheduled Roads.
NOC: Patwari report confirms distance from road center for Building Permissions.

title: Disaster Management Act
details:
Relief Manual: Patwari is the 'First Responder' to report loss (crops/house).
Forms: Prepares 'Nuksan Report' (Damage Report) for SDM.
Compensation: Rates fixed by Govt for crop loss (>50%) and house damage.

title: Indian Stamp Act (HP Amendments)
details:
Stamp Duty: Tax on documents.
Circle Rates: Minimum land value fixed annually by DC.
Categories: Patwari report classifies land (e.g., road-side has higher rate, internal has lower) to determine correct duty.

title: PESA Act
details:
Scheduled Areas.
Gram Sabha: Supreme authority.
Land Acquisition: Consultation mandatory.
Mining: No mining lease/license without Gram Sabha recommendation.
Intoxicants: Power to regulate sale/consumption.

title: HP Land Records Manual
details:
Ch 3: Duties of Patwaris (Residence, Diary).
Ch 4: Duties of Kanungos (100% Check).
Ch 8: Mutation Procedure.
Ch 9: Girdawari (Harvest Inspection).
Settlement: Usually conducted every 40 years to revise records completely.

title: Limitation Act (Appeals)
details:
To Collector: 30 Days.
To Commissioner: 60 Days.
To Financial Comm: 90 Days.
Section 5: Delay can be condoned if 'Sufficient Cause' (e.g., illness, wrong forum) is proved.
